meanings.definition: Knight Commander of the Order of the Bath (バス勲章ナイト・コマンダー)
meanings.english_definition: Knight Commander of the Order of the Bath, a British order of chivalry.

examples.sentence: He was appointed KCB for his services to the country.
examples.translation: 彼は国への貢献によりKCBに任命された。

etymology.value: An abbreviation for Knight Commander of the Order of the Bath.

usage_notes.explanation: KCB is a title awarded within the British honours system. It stands for Knight Commander of the Order of the Bath. It is typically awarded for distinguished service.

derivatives: GCB (Knight Grand Cross of the Order of the Bath)
CB (Companion of the Order of the Bath)

readability_explanation.text: KCB is an abbreviation for Knight Commander of the Order of the Bath, a high-ranking title in the British honours system, awarded for significant contributions. Understanding requires familiarity with British honors and titles.

example_sentences.sentence: Sir John Smith, KCB, attended the ceremony.
example_sentences.translation: ジョン・スミス卿、KCBが式典に出席した。
